Articles.Content:
Hmm...

Have you tried doing New Horizons. to Eeloo?

Or maybe try a Voyager I grand tour to Jool and Eeloo.

And I have to say, your minirockets really stretch the meaning of "minirocket".

I'm amazed that you can even reach the Mun with these, nevertheless Duna.

But maybe it's because I can't fly a rocket efficiently to save my life.

Circa 0.18:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

I'm rebuilding the Shuttle-M, but it's going to have over 200 parts (mainly because it has a tiny cargo bay).

when are you going to release the shuttle m?
also, i made a pico dragon and put it on the mun

when are you going to release the shuttle m?

I'm making a few changes to the shuttle ATM. Not sure when it will be ready, sorry.
Thx, i really like this space program, i got a mapsat into polar orbit around the mun with the epsilon 330x!
Found a new use for those new structural intakes:

Found a new use for those new structural intakes:

http://i.imgur.com/vRBK6bZ.png

Pico-Proton! That's adorable. Now flip it and back to the pad because someone mounted something upside down!

Rune. That would add a bit of dark-humored realism.

That already happened:

when are you going to release the shuttle m?

Looks like the radial decoupler bug ruined the shuttle, and I don't have the time to fix it. That said, here's the download for the shuttle: http://www./download/v17p9h8t7vvsjby/Shutte-M.craft

Edited October 15, 2014 by Giggleplex777
Nice use of the intake. Finding creative uses for new parts is always fun.

Finally I have fixed my pico dragon /falcon 9

Download link : https://www.dropbox.com/s/r5hf0vnoojsxj6s/Dragon%20and%20Falcon%209.craft?dl=0

Updated the Upsilon family. New fairings, new upper stage, and even a new rocket!

From left to right: Upsilon P, Upsilon A, and Upsilon B. 1.0, 1.75t, and 2.5t to 100km orbit respectively. The Upsilon Heavy has been omitted because those small fairings are too small to fit anything useful that weighs 5 tonnes.

I've been using these in my custom career mode game where all parts except for the KR-2L and LV-N are unlocked, and most of the funds come from science (set at 1000%). They're very useful thanks to their low cost and lifting capacity. They've effectively replaced the Epsilon series now.

Now so pico any more though. :/

Downloads:

A: http://www./download/zbv73kftq1lkzeo/Upsilon+A.craft

B: http://www./download/c4vbqe2q76cw3ee/Upsilon+B.craft

P: http://www./download/8ng13l6x3r4r1yw/Upsilon+P.craft

Edited October 26, 2014 by Giggleplex777

Cool!

10 char

Merely added fairing to it, not much else.
It looks out of scale to be honest. Guess there's not much you can do with rockets that size. In how many parts does it split?

It looks out of scale to be honest. Guess there's not much you can do with rockets that size. In how many parts does it split?

Two.

As for scale, the core stage and SRBs are a bit too short compared to the Centaur stage, so it should look better once I lengthen it.

Have you tried a combination of octagonal struts and 650 I-beams? I know they're damn heavy, but they might be a better choice for small fairings.

Status for Ariane:

Ariane 4 - Done

Ariane 5 ECA - Done (New boosters may be added)

I'll see if I still have them. Nevertheless, I have to rebuild the Ariane 5 anyways.

Edited November 12, 2014 by Giggleplex777

I spent more than an hour designing this Eve lander today. It quite a challenge to keep it compact enough to fit inside the less-than-elegant deployable heat shield assembly, but I like how it turned out.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

^View in full resolution for more detail.

The launch vehicle is an Upsilon B2, which is more than enough to get the job done, but the extra room for error in such a substantial mission is always welcome.

BTW, I made a few changes to the Upsilon family so that the fairings could be jettisoned at 40km (for verisimilitude). I'll post the download soon.

I noticed that the monopropellant tanks were about three times denser than the liquid fuel ones. I took this to my advantage and made greatly improved Pico Boosters that would finally eliminate the need to clip more fuel into the core stage or boosters.

Here's the new Shuttle-M:

Album:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

The boosters much last longer now and provide more delta-v. The new Shuttle-M can lift 0.4t more than the original.

Smaller versions of these boosters will be incorporated into other pico designs.
